io.dazraf.vertx.futures.http

Interface HttpFutures


  • public interface HttpFutures
    A set of factory functions to present Vert.x HTTP API as Future.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.buffer.Buffer> body(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientResponse response)
      Given a HttpClientResponse returns a Future<Buffer> for retrieving the body of the request as a Buffer
      static io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonArray> bodyArray(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientResponse response)
      Similar to body(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientResponse) except that it also parses the body buffer to a JsonArray
      static io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject> bodyObject(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientResponse response)
      Similar to body(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientResponse) except that it also parses the body buffer to a JsonObject
      static void checkHttpSuccess(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientResponse response)
      A helper function that checks the response code for a client or server error state 4xx, 5xx
      static HttpClientRequestWithFutureResponse future(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientRequest request)
      Wrap a HttpClientRequest as a Future<HttpClientResponse> The returned object has all the capabilities and methods of a HttpClientRequest.

    • Method Detail

      • future

        static HttpClientRequestWithFutureResponse future(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientRequest request)
        Wrap a HttpClientRequest as a Future<HttpClientResponse> The returned object has all the capabilities and methods of a HttpClientRequest.

        This means that we can use this function like this to chain http operations:

        e.g. 
         
 when(future(httpClient.get("/")).end())
 .onSuccess(HttpFutures::checkHttpSuccess)
 .then(response -> bodyObject(response))
 .onSuccess(body -> assertThat(context, body.containsKey("time"), is(true)))
 .onFail((Runnable) context::fail);
        Parameters:
        request - the HttpClientRequest as created by methods such as HttpClient.get(String)
        Returns:
        An object that implements both Future<HttpClientResponse> and implements all methods of HttpClientRequest

      • body

        static io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.buffer.Buffer> body(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientResponse response)
        Given a HttpClientResponse returns a Future<Buffer> for retrieving the body of the request as a Buffer
        Parameters:
        response - the response from a http call
        Returns:
        A future that will resolve to a Buffer if the Http response is not a HTTP error status

      • bodyObject

        static io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonObject> bodyObject(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientResponse response)
        Similar to body(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientResponse) except that it also parses the body buffer to a JsonObject
        Parameters:
        response - the response from a http call
        Returns:
        A Future that will resolve to a JsonObject if no HTTP errors or exceptions

      • bodyArray

        static io.vertx.core.Future<io.vertx.core.json.JsonArray> bodyArray(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientResponse response)
        Similar to body(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientResponse) except that it also parses the body buffer to a JsonArray
        Parameters:
        response - the response from a http call
        Returns:
        A Future that will resolve to a JsonArray if no HTTP errors or exceptions

      • checkHttpSuccess

        static void checkHttpSuccess(io.vertx.core.http.HttpClientResponse response)
                      throws HTTPException
        A helper function that checks the response code for a client or server error state 4xx, 5xx
        Parameters:
        response - the response from a http request
        Throws:
        HTTPException - if 4xx or 5xx
